snippet: A British officer advised Indian forces before they stormed the Golden Temple in Amritsar, killing hundreds, but the advice had little impact, the British government said.
abstract: British government says it sent military officer to advise India before Indian forces stormed Golden Temple in Amritsar in 1984, leaving hundreds dead, but advice was largely ignored and had little impact on bloody outcome; statement comes in response to internal inquiry into Britain's role in attack.
lead_paragraph: A British officer advised Indian forces before they stormed the Golden Temple in Amritsar, killing hundreds, but the advice had little impact, the British government said.

headline.main: Britain Says India Did Not Follow Its Advice in 1984 Army Raid
headline.print_headline: Britain: Briton’s Advice Was Said to Go Unheeded by India in 1984 Temple Raid
